alert.note: Alert for Henderson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 27 at 8:26AM EDT until May 28 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Henderson County in western North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of common, low-lying areas adjacent to streams is ongoing, including farmland, nurseries, greenways, and secondary roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 818 AM EDT, Stream levels across the French Broad tributaries will continue to fall this morning and gradually return to within their banks. The level of Mud Creek near Hendersonville is below flood stage, at 8.4 feet, and falling. Lingering high water conditions and floodwaters in low-lying areas will continue to recede. This warning will expire on schedule. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hendersonville, Flat Rock, Mountain Home, Laurel Park, Saluda, Dupont State Forest, Jones Gap State Park, Valley Hill, East Flat Rock, Crab Creek, Tuxedo and Dana. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
